intro: Euphrasia diekjobstii, commonly known as Diekjobst's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia diekjobstii is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
